title: Man seriously injured after jetski and kayak collide at Picnic Point
content:
A man has been taken to hospital in a serious condition and another is being questioned by police after a jetski and a kayak crashed on the Georges River in Sydney's south-west.

Emergency services were called to Fitzpatrick Park, at Picnic Point, about 11.25am on Saturday after reports a man was seriously injured in the water.

The man, whose age is unknown, was knocked from his kayak and "sustained a number of serious injuries", police said.

He was taken to Liverpool Hospital, where a spokeswoman confirmed he remained in a serious condition on Saturday afternoon.

Police said the 41-year-old man who was riding the jetski is assisting police with their inquiries.

The NSW Police Marine Area Command is investigating.
